chinguResourcesArticles.articleHeading: How to not f- up your local files with Git part 1
chinguResourcesArticles.articleSummary: Git is an essential tool for every developer, it keeps your code history in check and helps understanding what was done yesterday without freaking out. Working with a team requires a bit more than “git add” and “git commit” so let’s start exploring the beautiful world of Git.

chinguResourcesArticles.articleHeading: How to not f- up your local files with Git part 2
chinguResourcesArticles.articleSummary: This article is a continuation of part 1, while you can learn and enjoy this one without reading the first, I recommend you to take a look back on the etiquette of branches and workflow as I’ll use the same concepts from the first one.
